result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

superAgency.name: Lincoln County District Attorney
superAgency.notes:
Defendant to have no physical altercations with his mother.
The defendant shall follow through with all previously recommended mental health treatment and medication
Defendant to maintain attendance and passing grades at his online school
Failure to comply with any conditions of this agreement is sufficient basis to revoke the agreement and enter judgment.
Records provided by the defendant's mother, showing the Defendant is not attending school or not passing his courses, shall be basis for legal revocation of the deferral. 
If the defendant successfully completes all conditions of this agreement, the charge will be dismissed at the end of the deferral period.
Deft remains on the current bond while on the deferred.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon A Holzem

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devon A Holzem in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 2, Count 1 is DRI.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Clerk is directed not to enter the plea it will be deferred for 6 months with the following conditions
Defendant to have no physical altercations with his mother.
The defendant shall follow through with all previously recommended mental health treatment and medication
Defendant to maintain attendance and passing grades at his online school
Failure to comply with any conditions of this agreement is sufficient basis to revoke the agreement and enter judgment.
Records provided by the defendant's mother, showing the Defendant is not attending school or not passing his courses, shall be basis for legal revocation of the deferral. 
If the defendant successfully completes all conditions of this agreement, the charge will be dismissed at the end of the deferral period.
Deft remains on the current bond while on the deferred.
Plea hearing on January 18, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 27, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Devon A Holzem in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Meeting taking place with attorney  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Status conference on October 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
The deft to be at his residence located at 305 N Prospect St, Merrill from 9:00 pm to 3:00 pm the following day.  Live with his parents at 305 N Prospect St, Merrill
The deft to be at his residence located at 305 N Prospect St, Merrill from 9:00 PM to 3:00 PM the following day.   Live with his parents at 305 N Prospect St, Merrill.

Defendant Devon A Holzem in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 08:45 am.
